on the shores of the strait of magellan and it's

where you can see full-sized replicas of historic 
vessels the idea for this museum came to be when

a local businessman decided to build a replica of 
the now victoria to celebrate chile's bicentennial

well it proved to be no easy task the search for 
the ship's original plans took almost three years

and it was then another two years to complete 
the whole construction but today this museum

is considered one of the main draws to punta 
arenas we first visited the now victoria which

first set sail in 1519 as part of the spanish

the now victoria was the only ship to complete the
